Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Reasonably Cheapful - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Steve-And-Barbara
Reviews.Content: Was expecting not a lot for e30 a night and that's exactly what we got - not a lot. Bedrooms were basic, 3 single beds, TV on wall, toilet and shower room. Plastic table with 2 plastic chairs too. Windows opened and closed, doors worked, that's about it really. There was a communal shower in the hallway too though so at least two of us could have a shower at the same time (not together I hasten to add....) My mates on the next floor up though didn't have a shower, only a basin. Location wise it's excellent - 5 minute walk from Amsterdam Central Station, which in turn is only 10 min train ride from the airport. With regards to attractions etc, 5 minute walk to Dam Square, Sex Museum, Red Light District etc - Amsterdam is quite a small city actually and we never walked more than 15 minutes to get anywhere. If you're looking for a cheap room to get a decent sleep, this will do nicely - if you're used to your hotel luxuries, then perhaps not. Only bad thing I will say is about the stairs in this hotel. They were horribly steep! I consider myself quite fit but even I was short of breath by the time I reached the 3rd floor - so ask for a room on 1st floor if you can!!

Reviews.Title: “stairs from hell”
Reviews.Author: annepot
Reviews.Content: we went for a weekend to the quentin,on arrival we were greeted by a very nice young lady at reception,who was very helpful if you wanted to know anything.the lift wasnt working,and the stairs were ridiculously steep also stairs going into hotel was the same,so be very careful,infact we noticed that nearly everywhere we went in amsterdam is same,in bars,particulary.toilets seem to be all up steep winding stairs.the hotel room was small but clean, but was fine for 2 nights.the hotel is right next to canel.so if your lucky you might get a room with good view.the breakfast was average,tea coffee orange juice,toast cold meats youghrt,but be aware there are only 3 or 4 tables.we went down about 9ish for breakfast and managed to get a table at that time.over all had a lovely time,and hotel is very central,if your using public transport,like we did,we didnt pay a penny! you just get on train at airport and get off at cental station,theres no ticket man,and no barriers to go threw either.and trams are the same! plenty of bars and restuarants next to hotel,literally 1 min walk.you are spoilt for choice,for 2 pints of heinekein it averages from about 9 euros and up so not cheap.cheapest we found was 3.90 euro for a pint and that was down the red light distict.would go back to quentin but only for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “They weren't kidding about the stairs!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle J Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself was lovely and the rooms were nice. The stairs are a nightmare though! We paid for a budget room and my inlaws paid for a more expensive room and although they got a lovely view, our budget room was nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you like stairs”
Reviews.Author: Dave P
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a plesant weekend in Amsterdam, we stayed at the Hotel Quentin. All in all it was a nice hotel, the staff were first class but a little overstretched at times. (breakfast times) This is an old Amsterdam property and as with all old Amsterdam properties the stairs are something to be seen to be believed, very very steep and narrow. There is a lift but this had just broke apparantly but hey I need the excersise and it was all good fun. I would stay here again, its near the heart of the town, no problem to walk into the centre, or hop on the tram thats stops just near by, or even take the canal cruise thats stops right outside. We did all three!

Reviews.Title: “quentin hotel”
Reviews.Author: George Hunter W Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 101 it was room with bathroom the staff were really friendly and tried to help with whatever question you had i would recommend this hotel with 5 stars and will definatly be back the only trouble we had was trying to find the hotel the directions on website could be better and after asking three locals who sent us the wrong way we finally found it was good location about 10-15 min walk to dam square but trams run every 3-4 mins ideal for museums ect

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Quentin ...”
Reviews.Author: CJ_FS
Reviews.Content: We looked around for a hotel near to the â€˜Paradisoâ€™ (concert venue) as we were coming to Amsterdam for a concert there (and as our usual hotel seemed to be closed) â€¦ the Quentin Amsterdam seemed to fit the bill, in terms of price and location (64 Euros for a Friday night and 74 Euros for a Saturday night - room only)â€¦ Our room was compact, but it had a big window, looking out the side of the hotel on to the canal ! That won it for us, as the previous room they proposed us had no real window to the outside. There was a flat screen television and plenty of small lamps to give a good, cosy ambiance and some impressive large mirrors to give luminosity. The tiny bathroom was a dutch style â€œwetroomâ€�, but everything functioned well. Good news (compared to other Tripadvisor reviews) - the lift was working! But yes, those stone steps up to the front door of the hotel are very steep. Considering average hotel prices in Amsterdam, this is a central hotel at a reasonable tariff.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky I was here for just one night...”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdam_Chris123
Reviews.Content: ...but it is a night to remember. The rooms are small, dirty and very old-fashioned. On top, the staff is not very friendly. The only good thing about it is its location - straight next to Leidseplein with all its restaurants, bars, clubs, movie theaters etc. However, you might want to try another hotel in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Faye H Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, and it was a great location. The room was clean, and modern and included a TV. No tea and coffee making facilities though, but a coffee machine in reception, and costs 2.50 euro. Breakfast was nice, European help yourself to plenty of options, but there are plenty of places around if you didnâ€™t want to be tied to the hotel. Only a 10/15 minute walk to the shops, and close to many bars and restaurants. On the canal for easy access to the boat trips. A little expensive, comparable to a travel lodge. I would reccommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ivan j Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: All good small rooms but we only needed a bed ,Breakfast fine ,Bonus is that the lift is working well and the staff are very helpful .Hotel is just off tram no 1,2 and 5 10 mins from Central Station.Why pay more

Reviews.Title: “Good location and poor facilities”
Reviews.Author: Kalmac67
Reviews.Content: I stayed as part of a group of 6 last weekend. The rooms are basic, no tea or coffee making facilities (and was charged 2 to 2.50 euros in the hotel reception for a hot drink out of a vending type machine, even at breakfast!), there was no tv control, there was no hanging facilities for clothes, not a wardrobe or hook in sight! The room was draughty and the walls paper thin. The steps leading into the hotel are steep and narrow in depth and it was snowy and icy at the weekend and no one had tried to clear or salt the steps to make them easier to access. The very basic continental breakfast was very bleak and served up in what was part of the main reception, with just a few tables for all guest. Luckily enough there is a lift in the hotel because the stairs are very steep and not the easiest to walk up and down. My friends had to move rooms because their heating did not work properly and the attitude of staff was quite lapse. Another of our party had a mouse in the room, but could only be offered the room with no heating that our other friends had just vacated as all other rooms had guests in and was told that it was because they had a packet of sweets in their room that they had mice! There was no information packs in the hotel with regards to how to log on to wifi or even what number to dial if you wanted reception or even what time breakfast was, you had to keep on asking for everything!!! There was no info regarding things like fire escapes in the room. I would never stay in a Quentin hotel again. I have stayed in much better hotels and have paid less than the Â£ 90 plus a night that they charged for our room, from 4star hotels to travelodges!!!! If you dont care where you lay your head and want to be right in the middle of the leidsepleine than this if for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Amit R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Quentin for 5 nights and had great fun interacting with all the staff. Excellent location, nice rooms and service. Good breakfast and a complete value for money deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and helpful staff... All you need for Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: OxfordHolly M
Reviews.Content: A great, safe hotel in the heart of Amsterdam, overlooking the beautiful canal- just bars, restaurants and cafe's around the corner. A short, cheap tram ride to the famous Red Light District & museums. The 24 hour reception service with helpful staff who will provide all you need for your stay. Clean, spacious rooms with bathrooms which easily accommodate 3 adults. There was a party of 5 women who went for a birthday weekend and had the best weekend EVER!!

Reviews.Title: “No problems whatsoever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lucy C
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 3 night stay at the Quentin and we have no complaints at all. The lift worked the whole time we were there which is good as we did tackle the stairs on one occasion to the 4th floor and lets just say we were knackered!!! It seems as though our room had just been renovated as carpet was new, we didnt have the best of views from our window but we were not in the room that much. The location is good as it is right on the Liedseplein but we spent a lot of our time up by the Red Light/Dam Square and it is quite a walk, ok if the weather is good but you can always jump on the tram. We did not have any breakfast at the hotel so cannot really comment on that. Hotel staff were very friendly and always keen to assist. If you are looking for a nice basic hotel in a good location then this is the place to go. We would go back here and also recommend to friends:)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible shower”
Reviews.Author: ckblah
Reviews.Content: The lift was working, so I guess that's a good thing. The staff was alright, and not as rude as other reviewers mentioned. Location was alright, with food options readily available. Furnishing was on the skimpy side, with only a foldable chair and one electric socket available. Though there was a TV, there was no remote control. Had to stand on the chair to turn it on, and to switch channels. Carpet felt worn and not that clean. Shower was terrible, it would be scalding hot all of a sudden though it was already adjusted to the correct temperature. The next moment, it'd be ice-cold. Bad shower.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, ridiculous stairs”
Reviews.Author: angieruane
Reviews.Content: The one thing that stands out for me is the climb up the stairs to our room on the 4th floor. The lift had an 'out of order' sign on it, but from reading reviews it doesn't seem to have worked in years. I have no problem with normal stairs, but the staircases in here are almost vertical - and you can forget about the less than charming staff offering to help with bags. Entirely unsuitable for anyone who doesn't hike on a regular basis, anyone with children, anyone old, or anyone who is planning to drink alcohol. I have tiny feet and the treads were so narrow that I had to place my foot sideways on these stairs. Staff treated us like an inconvenience. Room key system was out of order so cleaning staff had to accompany us to let us into our room with the master key, as they muttered under their breath about having to do so. Room itself was fine but absolutely tiny. Staff and stairs both mean that I would never recommend or return to this hotel. Don't bother paying extra for the breakfast - it's a coffee machine in the reception area with a plate or two or shrivelled up looking food left out for guests. Go to a cafe nearby instead.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: baj2300
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great position on the canal and a charming look about it. The steps up to the hotel are steep and the steps to the room as steep, so with the lift not working you need to be reasonably fit. We had 3 to a room and the single bed was more of a couch and not overly comfortable. The double bed was fine, the room clean, water hot and strong. We found the staff friendly. It is only 150 metres to a good choice of restaurants and easily accessable from the central railway by tram. The trams though have a high and narrow entry so not good for lugging baggage.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike R
Reviews.Content: before coming, was apprehensive based on reviews. Place is fine - Clean room, friendly staff, yes the elevator isnt running. great location. quiet, on a canal, at checkin, they carried our luggage up the steep steps to our room. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Bargain basement stuff!”
Reviews.Author: Kimberley1982
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have asked for more from this bargainous hotel (apart from the lift to be working, as we were on the 4th floor!) The room was perfectly nice and fantastically clean and comfortable (which was all that we were wanting for our brief stay). As long as you don't expect luxury, you shouldn't be disappointed. The location is also superb- It's about a 15 minute walk (or short tram ride) away from Dam square and Leidlesplein is a wonderful hub of entertainment (particularly in the evening), with some fantastic and comparatively cheap restaurants surrounding it. There's even a bar boasting 30 shots for 27euros, though despite this, we were never disturbed at night. We also had access to the free wifi, which was useful. So, asides from the fact that they still haven't gotten round to fixing the lift (and the card machine not being in working order) which really are very minor complaints, it was a great stay and a great trip. Tip: If you are on the 4th floor and exhausted from hours of walking around Amsterdam, take advantage of the leather sofas in the reception area before tackling the steepest stairs in the world, it takes the edge off!!

Reviews.Title: “Just what it promises”
Reviews.Author: Pklasson
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel located just around the corner from Leidesplein. They've refurbished some of the rooms, but it's not top standard. The bathroom was clean but with the rustic crack in some of the tiles. The stairs were steep, but posed no prob for six normally healthy guys in their forties. No elavator.

Reviews.Title: “We would return”
Reviews.Author: Roamingkate
Reviews.Content: Agree with most of the previous comments, lifts don't work, wifi only works in the reception and the staris are steep! We stayed on the second floor so not too bad but we also had no luggage to carry just small backpacks. The location is perfect, great bars and plenty of choice for somewhere to eat. Close to tram stops. We didn't have a room with a view, but then its only a room and somewhere to sleep, depends what you want from your hotel. We found the staff very friendly and helpful, room were clean, can't commnet on breakfast as we didn't eat there. They had a secure luggage store, where we could leave our bags for the day after checked out. Would stay again if we needed too, but there are many others to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Doubt we'll return”
Reviews.Author: Kelandbob
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a 3 night stay at the Quentin Hotel and although I am not a serial "moaner!" I do have to agree with a few of the comments about this hotel. The stairs are extremely steep and narrow, and if you are bad on your legs,or tend to get out of breath easily, then you will have a problem as the lift doesnt work and I really dont think they have any plans to get it fixed in the near future. After a quick and easy check in we were given our room key, we were on the third floor and climbling the stairs with a suitcase each nearly seen us off but we actually laughed about it afterwards! We were in a standard double room and I was shocked at how small it was to be honest, although it has everything you need in there, comfy clean bed,wardrobe,and a clean bathroom with a shower, again very small but it works. My husband is a big chap and he found everything to be o.k....o.k being the operative word! The hotel offers a breakfast for 7 euro per person,and this can be paid whenever you require a breakfast which I thought was a good idea although we decided not to eat breakfast there. The location of the hotel is fantastic, a short stroll to the square which is filled with bustling bars and restaurants galore. If you are the type of person who likes comfort, and the type of hotel which will exceed your expectations then I would say this would not be the hotel for you. We wont be returning and next time I would gladly pay the extra money for a bigger better hotel but it didnt ruin our holiday at all because Amsterdam is superb!

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Nice.”
Reviews.Author: Tlux95
Reviews.Content: For what it is it's good. I stayed in single room for 3 nights. The communal bathroom is clean and not busy, so don't panic. Stairs are very steep but u get used to it after a day. Near by is a concert venue called Melk Welg. Touring bands play regular. Close to Van Gogh Museme. Breakfast is â‚¬7 but if you eat enough it can last you all day.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend...”
Reviews.Author: Katatravels
Reviews.Content: Booked Quentin Hotel as recommended by lonely planet... The room was tiny with scaffolding and workmen right outside our window hammering away in the early morning.. Staff not overly helpful to change our room or find a solution... The stairs were narrow and steep the lift was out of order...Hand rail was broken at the top of stairs which was very danerous...Constant noise of people walking up and down the stairs... Toilet didn't work properly... On the upside the hotel is in a great location and wifi worked well....

Reviews.Title: “Would Never Return”
Reviews.Author: al7096
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. The staff is super nice, and very accommodating. I could totally see how you could stay at this hotel and get a completely different experience. But for my husband and I.....it was not good. Our room was at the very tip top of the hotel. We had to climb up 4 flights of stairs to our room. You had to put your foot sideways to get up the stairs, very narrow; it felt like climbing a ladder. Our room had a dead bolt that didn't work, and a door that didn't fit directly into it's intended position. There was no safe in the room. The room was clean. Bathroom was nothing more than a closet with tile, a shower head, a sink, and a toilet. The view was into a brick wall. Three brick walls on all sides....and some windows..... There was never anything close to a breeze and the room was hot. We left after the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Would not come back”
Reviews.Author: annagiebels
Reviews.Content: We gave this place so many chances but it failed on so many counts. First of all, the elevator to take our luggage up to the room was not working, so we had to carry everything up 4 flights of long, steep, narrow and uneven steps. We couldn't find our room because it was hidden behind a closed fire exit door, and no one took us up to the room, so we had to head back down again to ask, and then proceed back up again. The room was clean, and so was the bathroom except that there was no ledge to keep the water in the shower from seeping out all over the bathroom. At the front desk, they also advertised to sell tickets to the Van Gogh without having to wait in line and a discount on tickets for the canal boat cruise, both about which the receptionist knew nothing. Most irritating was that the hotel advertised free wifi but this was also out of order, which we found out on the 2nd day, since the person on shift the day before didn't know after having given us the connection name and password but warning that the router didn't reach the 4th floor. There is a Starbucks within walking distance in Leidesplein that we hit up for internet access. That being the case, I also don't suggest getting the breakfast. Then again, I don't suggest staying at the hotel. On the upside, I will say that the location is good and the view of the canal from the breakfast room is lovely, even in the rain.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: KimHa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel! Yes, the room is smaller but we had plenty of space for our baggage. The beds were very comfortable and made each day for us, we even had a canal view! I booked the twin bed room because the doubles were sold out but they were next to each other anyway, with nice duvets. The stairs are narrow but it's part of the charm in a centuries-old building. The staff were very helpful and the breakfast is great, cheaper than going out. The tram is very close by to visit Dam Square and the Red-Light District, otherwise Leidesplein has plenty of restaurants, bars, shops and sights to see. If you're looking for a clean, comfy place to stay, this is it. You may hear people in the hallway but otherwise the hotel is down a side street next to a quiet canal. We'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: tandy1975
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to Amsterdam for his 40th birthday, i was looking for a place that was close to everything we wanted and clean. This hotel had both, the room was small but enough for us both and it was clean and tidy. The stairs were very steep and we were on the top floor. If your looking for a base this is perfect, we walked to Dam Square, Van Gogh Museum and Anne Frank's House, but if you don't want to walk the Trams are so close by and cheap. It is also close to alot of pubs yet out the way of any noise.

Reviews.Title: “Death to room 26”
Reviews.Author: ThereGoesDeon
Reviews.Content: My first night at the Quentin Hotel was spent in room 26, which is possibly the grimmest and most loveless hotel room in northern Europe. The room's door opens directly onto reception, from where, throughout the night, you will hear people beeping themselves in, laughing, singing, professing mutual affection and thanking each other for a wonderful, nay unforgettable, evening. I only slept by taking sleeping pills. Strong sleeping pills, like you take when flying long-haul in economy class. With whisky. The room itself has the manner of a room that used to be a luggage room. I've spent decades staying at European hotels and do not have American expectations of spaciousness. But the room simply was not wide enough to make it qualify as a room, even in Amsterdam. Look at the picture! Would you want to stay there? Would you?! I complained to staff about the room. They seemed to be used to receiving complaints about the room, and about the broken Wi-Fi, but still did not seem terribly concerned. (One girl appeared to have developed a Dutch version of the Gallic shrug, which one almost has to respect.) But I was moved to a room on the first floor -- room 101 -- when it became available the next day, and this room wasn't bad at all. Nice little view of the canal, conveniently close to the communal bathroom, entirely spacious enough for one person, and good value for money. For an extremely no-frills hotel room in central Amsterdam, room 101 isn't bad, thanks to the canal view. If you do book with this hotel, make it abundantly and repeatedly clear that you don't want any of the three rooms on the ground floor -- they will all be very very noisy. No-one should stay in room 26. Only book it for someone you hate.

Reviews.Title: “good for once”
Reviews.Author: justbiekris
Reviews.Content: friendly staff, everything clean, and in compare with other locations in amsterdam very cheep breakfast. BUT: de pictures of the rooms on the webstite, are not the rooms we slept in. That's a crime! and shame for the hotel! Very bad bed and matras. We will not repeat the comments on the stairs but be carefull when you had a drink and you want to end safely in your room. The walls are made from paper. We had very active neighbours but thats sometimes funny, that's Amsterdam. Very important: the location for visiting the city is very good. Conclusion: good hotel for visiting Amsterdam, bad hotel when you want to spent time on your room also.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a short stay and climbing steep stairs”
Reviews.Author: Clarky040
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a couple for two nights and it did the job but not much more. Brekkie included and staff were friendly. Location was really good. Next to main square where there are oodles of cafes and pubs. It appears that the lift was out of commission permanently and the stairs are extremely steep with not much surface area to step onto. Rooms were small but if its a short stay I would recommend this place. It was busy when we booked so was hard to shop around too much.

Reviews.Title: “POOR!!!”
Reviews.Author: madmoo69
Reviews.Content: Pictures not like the rooms at all. Rooms alot smaller than expected, a double room is fine for 1 person but way too small and cramped for 2 people sharing. Lift out of order so had to sturggle up lots of flights of steep stairs. Reception staff werent very helpful in all honesty and the cleanliness of the room was really average. Hotel in need of repair as cracks in the walls look dangerous. Very very basic and not worth the amount of money paid.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Ontario_Mother4
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel wasn't the best, was rather out of the way (from Dam Square) but close to the Flower Market and Torture Museum (awesome). Wasn't the cleanest place we've ever stayed but the room we had was nice and big. If you book through a service, it's very hard to cancel or change your reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Just the job”
Reviews.Author: chestercherry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of guys on my Stag weekend. Clean,basic,simple,great location,friendly staff,steep stairs. No frills but just the job.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, would definatly stay here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheJoys46
Reviews.Content: If you get the train from the airport, get the tram No. 1,2 or 5 to the hotel, we thought we would find it walking and it took ages!! We were very fed up by the time we got there! But takes bout 5 mins on the tram then a 1 minute walk.(which we found out after a day or so) The Hotel was lovely, after reading some reports on here I was slightly worried before i went and there really was no need to be. I paid for the standard double, yes it was basic. But the bed was nice, the bathroom was ok, there was clean sheets, clean towels a TV, wardrobe, so what more do you want? And we never heard any noice at all. If like me you don't want to have to go wandering for breakfast have it at the hotel, we did and i am really glad. 7 euros sounds a lot of money, but when you get there you'll realise you can't get anything anywere else any cheaper and it is buffet style so you can really fill yourself up. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a great location and would reccommend staying here to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good for couples on a very SHORT break”
Reviews.Author: Shads27
Reviews.Content: Ok so i just got back from staying at the Quentin hotel last week for 2nights with my boyfriend! The hotel itself is quite easy to find, although its MUCH easier to just get the 197 bus from the airport to Liedseplien (4euros) instead of the route which they specified! The location of the hotel is problably the best thing! 3mins walk from Leidsplien and all the shops, restaurants and coffee shops. About a 15mins walk from the red light district and Dam Square. Close but not TOO close to everything! Our room didnt over look the canal but it was just near by. A few problems initially with checking it, but they were sorted quite switfly. The staff were quite friendly and always on hand whenever I had a problem or needed directions. The room itself was TINY, about the size of my bedroom - and we stayed in an Economy Double room. Its fine if your staying with someone who your used to staying in confined spaces with, for a girly trip thoughid suggest a bigger room! Although it was very clean, I had no complaints in terms of hygiene and I'm pratically OCD when it comes to these things. The bed was comfy, quite large and clean sheets and towels were provided. My one complaint is that the room wasn't cleaned atall for the ENTIRE duration of our stay. We're both smokers and smoked in the room and didn't incur any form of fine so i'm going to say the hotel is SMOKERS FRIENDLY. Just ensure u specify a smoking room before hand!! Overall = the room was tidy, but TINY. Centrally located, and a good place if your going for a short break with a partner. Compared to some of the horror story hotels ive read about - with this one i was pleasantly surprised. OK value for money compared to some of the extortionately priced hotels - but i would have expected slighly more for 150euros!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok base, if you just want somewhere to put your head down?”
Reviews.Author: jojo7919
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the beginning of March 2011 with my boyfriend for 3 nights. The hotel has a fantastic location and very helpful and friendly staff, but I would not stay here again. I would pay that little bit extra for a better room somewhere else and I really am not one of those travellers who spends most of their holiday picking faults and taking photos of cracked tiles etc!! I'm pretty easy to please, but this was a joke. The room, albeit a lovely view over the canal was really tiny, and my boyfriend and I couldn't move. Our suitcase took up the entire floor space. The stairs really are extremely narrow and steep. You have to step sideways to get up and down but this is typical of Amsterdam. The lift was still out of order and originally we were on the 3rd floor, but we asked the lady on reception if we could move to a lower floor and she was very helpful and offered us a room on the 2nd floor, which we preferred. Also discovered I had left a hairbrush in the 1st room, which the staff kindly returned to me. The bed was comfy with fresh clean linen and towels every day, but the room itself was in need of urgent repair and up-dating. There were huge cracks in the wall and the shower only ran luke warm with no water pressure. It was clean enough, maybe just a little better dusting would be good though. If you are a solo traveller and just want a base to get a good night sleep, then it would be ok, but I wouldn't recommend for a couple as there just isn't enough room.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cub_Pop
Reviews.Content: Was originally booked into the Quentin England but when I went to check-in I was informed that the floor my room had been booked in had flooded and I had to move to this hotel which was around 4 minutes away & more central! The lady on reception at the Quentin hotel was very helpful & even marked out a map to show me how to walk to where I was meeting my friends later. I had been put into a room designed for 3 people even though my booking had been for 2 (ended up being myself in the room as friend was not able to make the trip). This meant I had a massive room with a double bed and a small enclave with a single bed (which became an extended closet!) The room was clean and due to being designed for 3 people was roomy. The bathroom was clean & double bed comfortable, I stayed for 3 nights and had no issues. I did not hear other guests, I could hear trams but this did not bother me. My room overlooked the river so was very pleasant. My friends however did not rate the Quentin England, so I seemed to have lucked out with my move of hotels when I checked in! The location is great, lots of restaurants (had dinner at the Hard Rock on the Saturday), bars, & general buzz to the area. The only negative is steep stairs and no towels in the room (lucky had brought one). So all in all for the price I had find it good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “LIFT out of order untill end of January 2011”
Reviews.Author: jagcat98
Reviews.Content: This is the message that greets guests, and beleive me the stairs are nasty - very steep and bad enough carrying nothing at all, we carried one case up to 1st floor and that was too much. God help you if you get the 4th floor!

Reviews.Title: “Very steep stairs, a broken lift and foundation works that shook 4th floor room at 7.30am”
Reviews.Author: slinkybabe30
Reviews.Content: On arrival, having booked thro easybook.com we were asked for 900E to settle a bill that hadnt been billed for, altho we thought it had. Then we were presented with rooms throughout the hotel floors, up to the top 4th floor, only to be told that the lift wasnt working - there was also a small sign on reception stating that building works were taking place. The stairs were so steep and so many it required a rest 2 floors up and holding on to both bannisters both up and down. The first morning we were awoken by a thundering hammer every 30 seconds that shook the windows and the room. On complaint we were told city hall told the hotel they would be working on foundations in august and hotel said it was on their website - needless to say none of us saw this when checking the site!!!?! I was told works would cease saturday morning, which wasnt strictly true, we could have free and tea and coffee or be moved. There see,ed little point in moving with one night to go. Overpriced, basic, no kettle and one towel each and unconcerned with their residents comfort or concerns. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “A tired hotel with steep stairs and NO lift!”
Reviews.Author: AngDav99
Reviews.Content: This hotel had been recommended by family who had stayed there a couple of years prior and loved it. We arrived to find a note at reception saying the lift was out of order for 6 months. We were staying on the 4th floor and luckily had only small bags because I have never seen steeper stairs. Unfortunately we had older family members with a lot more luggage staying on the second and third floors and there was no offer of help with their luggage. We had no towels when we got in our room, and the heater in our room was broken so instead a small fan heater had been left in the room (which was so noisy that we turned it off and were cold instead - we were in Amsterdam for the marathon and really needed some sleep). The walls were paper thin and I have a feeling the fourth floor may be the 'party floor' judging by the amount on noise late in to the evening. Overall we had a very disappointing stay. The area is wonderful but the hotel was not. We even had to pay a 20 euro deposit for a remote to operate the tv or a hairdryer!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: carlps
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Quentin Hotel from friday to monday and had no problems at all. The room was clean and cleaner came once during our stay. The accomodation is far from 5 star but nice all the same. Well worth the money and in a great location just next to the leidesplein square, would stay there again next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “What an experience(a very bad experience)”
Reviews.Author: 93lingarda
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. Thank god it was for only one night is all I can say. in fact we managed to spend only about 8 hours in the hotel, thank god. When we first opened the door to our room we were hit by an overwhelming smell of paint . This was due to the fact that the room was still in the process of being painted!. In fact the paint tin was still in the room along with the brushes and other tins. This meant that we had to sleep with the window open and because the hotel is situated in the very centre of Amsterdam(a bonus for some) the noise from outside was very load all night. We had a terrible night sleep and I strongly advise to never book a room in this hotel in fact if you see a hotel even called quentin than leave immediately just in the off chance they are oqned by the idiots who run this one

Reviews.Title: “We will NEVER stay here again- small, hot, and loud!”
Reviews.Author: kmack143
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was so awful, we left a day early! The best thing about it was the location, which is in the central city, & easy walking distance to all the sites. The worst thing was also the location. Since it is so centrally located, people walk by the windows and within the hotel all night long. It was so loud our one night there, that we could not get to sleep until 5 am. The other thing is the heat. No A/C, no fans, & 80-90 degree weather= unbearably hot. Between the heat & the noise, we could not sleep. The room was tiny. The bathroom as small as a closet without a shower stall- just a shower fixture mounted on the wall next to the toilet, so everything gets wet. The front staff was very friendly & helpful. No parking at the hotel & no internet. The only parking around is 4 euro/hr. We will definitely not ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, terrible conditions.”
Reviews.Author: KyleH13
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Quentin near the end of May, and checked into room 3 to stay 3 nights. We went into the room and noticed first that it was hot and smelt musty. The carpet felt sticky when it was walked on and there looked to be water damage on the far wall and on the ceiling of the bathroom. The window was broken, it was being held up by a rope and the gap that was left was being stuffed by two towels. The window was also broken, and the drapes were also damaged and no longer could cover the whole window, which looked out onto the street. We went back to reception to try to change rooms and were told there were only triple rooms left and they would not switch us, and that we should try again the next morning to see if someone checked out of a double room. When told that we felt the broken window on the main floor didn't let us feel comfortable leaving our valuables in the room, we were told that it should be okay. Left reception and returned later, to check again if we could switch rooms and again told no. The hotel maintenance manager followed us back to the room and took a look at the window and returned later with a roll of masking tape to hold the drapes closed. We sucked it up and decided that it could be worse and tried to make the best of it. The next morning the cleaning staff woke us up as they were banging around in the hall at around 7:30am, this noise continued until we left the hotel around 10:00am. The walls are paper thin and you can hear everything, every person coming in or out of the hotel, people walking up and down the stairs, etc. The cleaning staff "cleaned" our room after the second night and it seems all the did was straighten the sheets and dump the contents of my girlfriend's backpack onto the floor. The bathroom had no shower stall, so when you took a shower the floor of the entire room would become wet, and the toilet would never flush fully. The only plus side of this hotel was that it's location, excellent location. For the 85 euros we paid a night for this room, we got ripped off. I would not suggest this hotel to anyone, ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere next to Leidseplein, where the heart of nightlife beats”
Reviews.Author: nasosasos
Reviews.Content: Very professional service, cute and clean rooms, most of them with amazing views.... one of the best low cost hotels in the centre of Amsterdam!!! Me and my fiance had a lovely time there, so we highly recommend it to everybody, and we are looking forward to staying there again as soon as possible. *Special thanks to Walter, the Italian receptionist who was all the time willing to help giving correct advises

Reviews.Title: “Meets my expectation with some pleasantries”
Reviews.Author: Travelholic69
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room for 2 nights. We were given a double bed & a single bed in an oddly shaped room at the front of the hotel facing the canal. The bathroom/toilet was clean. However, the shower curtain was not enough to shield the rest of the bathroom/toilet floor from getting wet. Perhaps they should install a screen, but it's not a major problem for us. We have no complain for the price we pay according to European standards. The night clerk was helpful & accommodating. Perhaps the only major problem we have was that the entrance was not at ground level. It was a steep, plus/minus 10-steps of stairs from the road level to the entrance. I think that's the only negative part which happens only twice - when we check-in & check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Worth what you pay”
Reviews.Author: seahunter11
Reviews.Content: It was clean, ready as we arrived, and had heat, you can have breakfast on the lobby wich has the most beautifull view of one of the many channels. The crew was nice enogh. Even though it would be better if they could have internet. The best?: LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!

Reviews.Title: “If you don't pitch your expectations too highly, it'll seem like a good offer.”
Reviews.Author: ADLNetherlands
Reviews.Content: For the price, the location is excellent, but the room was rather basic for the 70Euros for a double. It was just about clean enough, if the hairs in the bathroom are ignored. All fixtures and fittings were reasonably new but there were some omissions, perhaps case of some things being done by half. For example, a tv stand without a tv, a rail for shower curtain without a shower curtain and only one curtain over the window, instead of two... If you're not too fussy it should be fine.... Would I recommend this hotel to a friend? Yes, but with the above buts....

Reviews.Title: “NOT CHEAP OR CHEERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: rachiio
Reviews.Content: Got to say the location of this hotel is excellent, the room was clean and our room was cleaned three times within our 6 day stay. However the room itself was tiny! just enough room for one person if you ask me, it was also ridiculously hot. When we opened the window we discovered our room was facing a building site which was noisy as hell! We were woken up at about 7.30 each morning by that or the sound of people banging doors in the hotel. The bathroom was ok but there was rust at the bottom of the shower. Staff were helpful enough but never seemed overly happy to see you. They did help us with our suitcase when it spilt on the way home. Prices of snacks etc was crazy but so is all of Europe at the mo. This is our 6th visit to amsterdam, would never go back to this hotel, would rather stay in a hostel!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Hotel At Any Cost”
Reviews.Author: 416er1
Reviews.Content: I went for an exhibition (IBC) in Amsterdam and booked this hotel online. Unfortunately, I booked it first and then read the reviews. After learning about shared bathroom and showers and no elevator I called the hotel where they confirmed this information. I immediately canceled the reservation, however, their policy is not to refund anything. Reservation was made over booking.com. Be aware DO NOT book over booking.com and stay away from Quentin hotels wherever they are. They are fraudsters. I called my credit card and they said that they can't do much since it is merchant policy not to refund the money. If you know what can be done in this case to get a refund please let me know, I will be very very grateful. president at webguruscanada dot com

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: MiiFinland
Reviews.Content: Good location. Good price. Small rooms. Clean enough. Nice and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible staff, cramped room, decent location”
Reviews.Author: roserhapsody
Reviews.Content: My sister and I booked two nights in this hotel after staying a few nights in a frighteningly sleazy hostel. It seemed pretty and clean and we got a good last-minute rate. However, the experience was even worse than our hostel. The receptionist who greeted us when we arrived was, without exaggeration, the rudest person I've met in any hotel/hostel I've stayed in. We arrived around 11 and she insisted that we couldn't check in until 2pm, although no one had told us of this check-in time when we booked the reservation. She flat-out refused to hold our luggage until check-in time and insisted we lug it all the way to Central Station to store it (for a fee of course), then return to the city, then travel back to central station, then return to the city again in the intervening time. Despite our forced politeness she was sarcastic, severe, and even frightening. Besides this the room was small and cramped, overheated, only had a view of a construction site (which was noisy all day), and the window barely opened. Please find another place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feellings..”
Reviews.Author: Bungan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Easytobook.com. What we dislike about this hotel was..... 1)The carpet was dirty and the window was broken..so we could not close it. Our first room faced a construction site and it gets very noisy in the day..(but you are not going to spend the rest of the day in the room anyway). Only that it gets pretty annoying when your nice sleep was awaken by the noises and you just had to wake up really early. 2)Room was very small. The moment you opened the door..the bed is just 2 meters away from the bed and the bathroom is another 3 meters..and that is it. What we l liked about this hotel was... 1)Its location is strategic and you can basically go anywhere from there without much hassle. Pretty easy..as long as you have a map with you. 2)The staffs were pretty helpful with directions... We were moved to another room when we decided to extend one more day as our first room was already booked by somebody else. But anyway, this time, the room faced..(well slightly faced the canal). This room was much larger...and not facing construction site..less noise...but still...the carpet was dirty!! Window still broken... Overall..it is just ok-ok. We were tired by the time we reached the hotel so it did not really bothered us..

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and not nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kitty_B72
Reviews.Content: After a hefty climb up the steep stairs to get to the lobby barely managing to carrying our luggage up the steep steps. We went to the desk to check in we found out about the 5% surcharge of paying with a credit card. After a hard days travel we didn't have the energy to climb the stairs again to find the ATM to get cash for the 2 day stay in the Hotel. Then we had to pay insurance if we wanted a remote for the TV which we did and were handed a remote that we found out later didn't work for our TV in our room and they never found one that did. The TV is mounted up on a wall so since I'm not the tallest person I had to climb up on a chair every time I wanted to change stations or the volume on the TV. I was kind of startled when I entered the room it seemed to be dirty, there were cigarette burns in the carpet and the small desk and there was a big gap torn out of the curtains. Only every other light bulb in the room worked but they replaced that quickly when we asked them to. Due to renovations on the floor we were staying on our room had a heavy smell of paint. And during our stay it was quite noisy due to the renovations but at night the hotel was nicely quiet. The bathroom in our room was quite shabby and the shower wasn't separated from the rest of the room so every time someone takes a shower the whole bathroom gets wet and the floor dangerously slippery. My husband took a shower and didn't notice a puddle of water that had collected at the door then so I went to use the bathroom and stepped int to the puddle and took a tumble on the slippery floor and I was just lucky not to get seriously hurt. With this kind of arrangement they should really have some kind of squeaky to get the water of the floor and down the drain after an shower. We had "pets" in our room a pair of some kind of beetles which I did my best to throw out the window when I could catch them but there always seemed to be more of them so finally I gave up. The staff in the reception often seemed rather uninterested in helping and it could take a good while to get service from them even if you were the only one there. The breakfast there was OK nothing fancy and rather pricey for it's quality. The good thing about this hotel is it's location it is right next to the Leidseplein that has a lot of fine restaurants and shops. Its only a short walk to the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum. And it's a reasonable walk from Dam Square and the main shopping district. From Leidseplein it's a easy straight ride by pram to the Central station if you want to travel some more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Judy15
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel was its location being right in the heart of the busy restuarant/cafe/bar area. easy enough walk to the city sights, shops and centraal station, it was a good base for exploring the whole city by foot or tram. The hotel itself was shabby, the room very small, dirty and basic. We had problems with the toilet flush (fixed within the day) and on several occaisions the lift was out of order during our 3 day stay. Not a problem for us but for the less mobile the stairs are extreemly steep! Overall the place was expensive for what it was. The breakfast at 7 euros would be an absolute rip off when you can walk only a few minutes from the hotel and get lovely coffee and crossiants, rolls etc from bakery shops. Probably the worst thing about this hotel was the 5% surcharge for paying by credit card!!! We knew nothing about this untill we arrived, another rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Hate the Quentin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jazmineta
Reviews.Content: The Questin Hotel was the worst experience we had in Europe. We saw a rat (not a mouse) in our room. The hotel was totally dirty an the attention was terrible. Rooms were a disaster. Very small, unclean and uncorfortable. Too Expensive for getting that awful services.

Reviews.Title: “No welcomes here!”
Reviews.Author: Freddiemc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a central location and is cheaply priced but you get what you pay for. Don't expect any hospitality or helpfulness from the staff. We pre- booked four nights through the internet. They were over booked when we arrived and we had to change rooms three times and check out/check in each time. The staff were cold and lazy. The lack of communication bertween staff meant that we were cross examined about payments we made the first night. Staff spent most of the time staring at the television and we almost felt like we were an inconvenience if we went to reception. There is no luggage storage so we had to take a tram to central station to put our bags in lockers the last day.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: suffragettecitygirl
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with my boyfriend for 4 nights in august 2008. the location couldn't be better... right on the leidseplein canal, only minutes from the trams/buses, tonnes of shopping, bars, and restaurants, and vondelpark. you can even rent canal bikes right outside the hotel! the biggest problems we had with the hotel were the construction going on outside our window (which is probably over and done with by now, but was annoying at the time), the lack of air conditioning, the mosquitos that came in when we had the window open, and the shower which got water all over the bathroom floor. nonetheless, our double room was clean, comfortable, and had a bed in that was tucked into the corner, making the room seem a little larger than it would have otherwise, while providing extra under the bed storage space. the staff was very friendly and gave me hot water when i wanted to make neo citran for my sore throat. in the area, DO NOT go to the sports bar around the corner which advertises pancake breakfast unless you want a tiny, awful cup of coffee for 5 euros. DO go to the pofferijes house across the bridge for excellent pancakes/fritters and wonderful cappucino. we also couldn't live without maoz falafel while in amsterdam! and be sure to check out electric lady land, it's a black light museum run by a lovely and intelligent man named nick.

Reviews.Title: “Be Aware Of Quentin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ryan2222
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights at the end of september 2008. The location of the hotel is good, close to Leidsplein but this hotel is the worst hotel I have ever been to. The room is tiny and very dirty. They promised a canal view but the single window in the room could not be opened and so there was no air circulation in the room. The worst thing about the stay at Quentin were mice running across the room and on the table where i was supposed to eat! I complained about the mice at the reception, and was told that they are aware of this problem but are not willing to compensate me on all the food that I had to throw away because of the mice. A truely disgusting and dirty hotel with terrible service that does not live up to the standard of service and sanitary at most hotels in Amsterdam. Be Aware!

Reviews.Title: “Downstairs is nice but the rooms aren't good at all”
Reviews.Author: MugUK
Reviews.Content: Where to begin ... we were a party of 6. One double (for two), one twin and one double for a single person (someone else had already booked themselves in as they were on a different flight). Our room had pillows covered in - I hope - sweat stains. A broken pane in the wet-room/shower/toilet, a huge crack in the basin and the shelf that was supposed to be underneath the mirror was on the window sill. The 'extra' blanket was covered in 'something' - so it wasn't used and handed to receptionist (she also gave us a new pillow to use - so plus points there). The others in our party were equally unimpressed - downstairs the loo wouldn't flush properly, there was only one hair-dryer for the entire hotel and a lingering smell of damp. The other two people in their separate rooms weren't exactly enamoured with them either - probably should be single rooms but had a double-bed shoe-horned into the room. Was annoyed at the 5% surcharge for c/cards too .. if you want somewhere close enough to the town centre but far enough away from the noise then it's a nice enough hotel. But once you're in the room(s), it starts to go pear-shaped!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel....staff soooooo rude!”
Reviews.Author: DublinDotty
Reviews.Content: Ok, so it's an old hotel, rooms, are reasonably clean (I could walk around the room in my bare feet) which says alot. There are no extras such as safety deposit boxes, you get one towel which is replaced every two days (another towel would be helpful as the bathroom is a wet room so water from the shower gets everywhere so it would be nice to stand on something as opposed to nearly killing yourself on the slippy tiles!) behind the beds and the skirting boards could do with a good clean but overall, it's grand, location is excellent I have to say, views are also nice. But one receptionist (I think the guy who probably owns the hotel) is so unbelievably horrible, tight and rude. My poor friend's suitcase got lost and we asked him if he would ring us on the mobile if it turned up at the hotel while we were out and he simply asnwered no because it would cost him to make the phonecall! He was sarcastic....you have to pay a â‚¬ 20 deposit to get a remote 4 ur TV and when I asked if I would defo get it back, I recieved a very smart and sarcastic reply to the meaning of a 'deposit'. Overall, it's grand, I mean don't be expecting any extras...I stayed in the Singel Hotel near central station before and it was much better so would recommened that...just not as central but still pretty close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alanjm160684
Reviews.Content: Location - Excellent, just round the corner from main areas. Hotel - Clean, plain, old. Room - Comfy bed, Wardrobe with 2 hangers inside, TV with loads of channels, we even watched Eastenders one night. Window view was of a building site at the back end of the hotel (not the hotels fault), we stayed in room 406. Service - The bedding was changed, the towels were taken but not replaced. Bathroom - Clean, good shower, decent sized mirror. Staff - Only ever saw one person sat behind reception, polite-ish. Other - Apparently there is a bar in the hotel but there was no signs or anything. Overall, if I was going to visit Amsterdam again I would pick the Quentin Hotel as it's all you need as you tend not to spend that much time there anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Situated perfectly; Simple but clean”
Reviews.Author: graz_1
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our trip to Amsterdam, where we stayed at "The Quentin" for three nights. Having read the reviews here I really was a little bit scared what would be awaiting us. We had a double room on the 4th floor. It was - as we were expecting looking at the prize of the hotel room - quite a small room but we had a perfect view of the canals in direction to the bridge. The room and the bathroom were very simple, but clean. When there was a problem with the heating in our room (quite in the evening), it was immediately solved. The hotel is situated on one of the best places in Amsterdam (100 metres from the Leidseplein). The tram station is a 3-minutes-walk away... There are lots of little restaurants, pubs, cafes around so that we didn't have breakfast in the hotel. Summary: a cheap hotel, clean, friendly... would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay and hotel What is the problem with some people?”
Reviews.Author: brynrob52
Reviews.Content: We have not long come back from this Hotel, It is based in an excellent part of Amsterdam which i have been to many times, I have never been to this Hotel before but i would say if you are looking for a Hotel which is close to all amenities, this is for you the rooms are ample but clean. The upper floors are great and have a lift. It is a hotel on a budget which believe me you can get a lot worse than this. The staff are friendly and it is one of the easier Hotels to check into yes you pay on arrival but this is a natural thing when abroad. The only down side which i could see is that there are no safety deposit boxes unless this is a must for you stay at the Quentin Hotel by the Leidseplein, you really cannot go wrong, 6 guys cannot be wrong can we.

Reviews.Title: “Find Somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: rxxm
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a number of problems. First as soon as we arrived they asked for payment up front in cash. Credit cards cost 5% extra. We asked for a non smoking room when we booked and on arrival we were given a room that had a strong smell of smoke. There was an ash tray in the room so it was obviously not a non-smoking room. When we asked for a different room we were told there were no others and that the hotel can't stop guests smoking. In other words there is no respect for the guest's wishes. The room was very very small. We stayed in a double room. The room is only as wide as the bed. You have to crawl over the other person to get into bed. The television was up high on top of the wardrobe. There is no remote control so you have to climb on the table to get to the television controls. When we asked for a remote control the lady at reception immediately demanded 20 euros then said she couldn't find the remote control. The room keeping is sloppy too with no soap or towels in the room when we arrived and the bed sheets had cigarette burns. Behind the hotel is a construction site which started making nose at 8am every morning. The hotel has no facilities for internet and no breakfast included in the price. I would never stay at this hotel again. There are far better hotels in Amsterdam for a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: brummiebirdWestMids
Reviews.Content: I saw the hotel on there wesite and it looked ok and the price was pretty cheap so i booked it for my stay in amsterdam. When we rrived outside we were greeted by alot of scaffolding and had to fight out way up the steep stairs. When we entered the lobby we noticed that there was no bar which was advertised and the receptionist was far from pleasent and didnt greet us, just wanted the money then gave us our room keys. When we entered the room the smell of sewerage and mould instantly hit you. The room was tiny, hardly big enough to fit our suitcases in!! The carpet was disgusting, it was stained sticky and had obviously not been hoovered for a VERY long time! Lets just say i refused to walk on it bare foot! The walls were stained with what only can be described as blood and needed painting. The sheets were blood stained, so i went and complained only to have been met with a 'what can i do about it' so i asked for new sheets and i made the bed myself! The room was not cleaned once during my 3 night stay and i had to ask again for towels. The bed was literally a piece of wood and the curtains were ripped and yellow from never being washed. The bathroom smelt like sewerage and there were bugs in there! The sink was cracked and the shower flooded when you used it. They wanted a 20 euro deposit for the remote for the tele but as i might never have got it back i had to climb on a chair to operate the tele because it was literally touching the ceiling! The worst thing about it all was the fact that there was a building site 20 metres away from our widow and every morning we were woke up at 6am to the sound of a building being demolished!! The morning that we checked out at 11am complained again and the receptionist just turned her back on us! We couldnt leave our bags in the lobby so we had to drag them round with us for 5 hours!!! DO NOT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “What a hole. Avoid this place at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: keztun
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room at the Quentin Hotel in early August 2007. When we arrived the exterior of the place was covered in scaffolding and shade cloth and we had to duck under a metal pole to be able to climb the steep stairs to the reception. Our main reason for choosing to stay at this place was that it was listed in the Europe on a shoestring Lonely Planet Guide book, and it's seemingly reasonable price compared to other hotels in Amsterdam. But boy do you get what you pay for (in a bad way). We checked in and they wouldn't let me use my Travelex Cash Passport Card to pay, which is meant to be able to be used at any place that accepts Visa Credit cards. I was a bit suss about this since a few reviews on this site had warned about giving this place your credit card details. WARNING: If you are planning to pay by credit card they charge you a 5% surcharge. hmmph great! So when we were given our room key and we went to get in the lift to go upstairs the receptionist stopped us and said that she had forgotten to tell us that our room was actually in the basement of the hotel. We scaled the sticky stained red carpet that went downstairs with our luggage to see a room at the end of the corridor that looked like the janitors closet. When we managed to unjam open our door the stench hit us of extreme mould and g0d knows what else. The stained, sticky carpet stuck to your shoes with every step. Needing to go to the bathroom, my boyfriends stepped into the room, only just big enough to stand in, to find that it was wet on the walls and the floor. The ceiling was dark with mould and it became clear to us where that stench was coming from. There was no actual shower recess so when you showered (if you dared to) the whole bathroom would flood. The toilet made a noise like the world was coming to an end when you flushed it. The bed linen was stained with blood and other body fluids. The only window in the room which we opened to try improve the smell, opened into a courtyard where the hotel's dumpster was and the staff chained up their bicycles, which then opened onto the street. We went out and walked around the city for hours just to avoid having to stay in our room, but when we returned and none of us wanted to lay down on the bed to go to sleep, we decided that it was ridiculous that we were paying to stay a place like that. At 2am, we went up to reception to complain and see about cancelling our next 2 nights stay, and the guy on night duty at reception seemed to understand that room 002 was substandard to stay the least. He came and mopped the bathroom and gave us fresh towels and bed linen, apologising and promising to move us to a better room the next day. The room we were moved to was on the top floor (401), was a bit better, but they still didn't give us soap, towels or really clean the room at all the whole time we were there. The guy that checked us out seemed a little strange to say the least. If you HAVE to stay in a triple room in this place, make sure that you request 401 and NOT 002...but I would STRONGLY ADVISE AGAINST STAYING HERE AT ALL.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there”
Reviews.Author: Badbob1979
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Quentin last night, and was quite simply the worst hotel I've ever stayed in (and I've stayed in some rough ones). The room was so damp that it stank, the walls were peeling and I woke up at 7 am (after 2 hours sleep) covered in what can only be descibed as dew. I was kept awake all night by a Spanish couple arguing and when I informed the guy on reception (who was also Spanish), he said (sarcastically) yeah, yeah blame the Spanish and tried to make a joke of it. The place was totally unacceptable, even if it was cheap. Don't go there

Reviews.Title: “Cheap in every sense!!”
Reviews.Author: Guitarman2007
Reviews.Content: Hmmmm. I'll start by saying don't be put off by some of the overly negative reviews you might have read. My 3 night stay at The Quentin Hotel wasn't a great one by any means - but to be fair, it's relatively cheap......so I guess you get what you pay for!!! On the plus side - the hotel is right on the doorstep of all the local amenities, restaurants, etc... and my room overlooked a canal (which was quite pleasant). The staff seemed reasonably friendly & helpful. On the minus side: the walls were paper-thin so I didn't get a good night's sleep with all the late-nite / early-morning banging and crashing (from other guests, revellers, cleaners, etc...) so I felt shattered for much of my holiday! The rooms were generally clean - but tatty and in need of a paintjob and some new carpets. Be warned - there is NO bar (as advertised). Nor are there any tea or coffee facilities in the rooms (which I found a real hardship!). There was no sink /en-suite facility in my room either (just a shared toilet / shower down the hallway). There is no full-English breakfast. Also, you have to pay a 20 euro deposit for the TV remote control (no, really!!!). They also expect payment on arrival (including a 5% charge for paying by credit card). As I said before, to be fair, The Quentin Hotel is relatively cheap if you just need somewhere to get your head down for the night. I enjoyed my time in Amsterdam. But don't expect any luxuries at The Quentin - you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: frefre123
Reviews.Content: This was a terrible hotel,upon arrival,we were asked to pay the full amount ( they charge an extra 5% for credit card payment ) ,the room was very very tiny with no space at all and a very small window and no fan in the room. They asked for a 20 euro deposit for the TV remote which did not work, but lo behold the TV was mounted close to the roof of the room and the receptionist very rudely asked me to manually operate the same ( I assume by climbing the rickety chair in the room ) . They were very reluctant to give any towels and soaps and I had to battle the rude folks at the reception. The icing on the cake was that when it started to rain in Amsterdam,it started raining in the bathroom as well,since there was an open pipe hole on the roof ,this was disgusting !!! When we mentioned the same to the receptionist ,she said she can't do anything so asked us to live with it !!!! I have stayed in many hotels in Europe for the same price i.e. 110 euros which were simply wonderful ,given a choice I'd rather sleep on a park bench than at this hotel. In a nutshell ,stay away from this shanty they call a hotel ,

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: ImAWheel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was likely the worst place I have ever stayed. Upon check-in, we were given a key to our room in the "dungeon-annex." Our ground-floor shoebox, complete with bed raised on cinderblocks, directly blocked a sliding-glass door to the outside. I realized that door didn't lock, so I called the front desk, and a man came to check it out. When he discovered the lock didn't actually work, he left & returned a few minutes later with a power drill, and drilled the door shut so it couldn't be opened at all. Apparently fire codes don't apply at this place. After he left the room, I flicked the light switched on, at which time every electrical appliance in the room blew out. I'd wasted many vacation hours at this point, so I packed my things & went to the front desk. I explained the situation to a very nice receptionist, who called the manager. In 15 minutes she (manager) stormed into the hotel & gave us a refund only after a lot of back-and-forth. She looked really angry & simply barked "go!" at us. The receptionist looked embarrassed & was nice enough to make calls & help us reserve one of the last available rooms in the city. My recommendation is to stay anywhere else but here, if you can help it!

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was fine!”
Reviews.Author: michellewillsher
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Quentin for 3 nights for a weekend away with my boyfriend and anouther couple. After reading the reviews I was expecting the worst but was pleasently suprised! We had a double booked and one econamy double as that is all they had left when I booked over the internet. On arrival we were told they only had a twin and econamy double and that we had to pay the 5% credit card charge even though I was paying with a debit card? So I was a bit angry with that but it was 12 at night and we were not in the position to argue! We payed the charge and excepted the twin and just pushed the beds together which was fine. The rooms were clean and had towels! The econamy double was tiny but we were expecting it to be small as it is called an econamy double! (On the last day we were alowed to leave our lugage in a locked room downstairs in the bacement. The basement rooms didn't look too good so If you book this hotel ask for the upper floors!) The staff were friendly and helpfull. The location was perfect you have all the bars and sights a short walk or tram ride away. On the whole I think we got what we payed for we were not expecting luxuary because we had'nt payed for luxuary. We got clean basic rooms in an ideal location. We all said we would go back there again. Dont be frightened by some of the reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Youth Hostels May Be a Better Choice”
Reviews.Author: JaDo24
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Quentin during the IBC convention. I meant to write a review about it when i returned - but time flew and here I am booking another IBC stay which reminded me of the horrible stay in 2006 at the Quentin. First treat was that they cut the rooms in half to get more rooms in the hotel. I barely fit in a double with my luggage. Further, my neighbors were late nite prowlers who went at it loudly at all hours of the nite. Wouldn't have been so bad but the walls were so paper thin I could have sworn I was in the room with them (creepy). Second was the film of filth and dirty underpants in the hallway. Love seeing that first thing in the morning. Just plain gross. Third - you want to watch TV to drown out your neighbors? have to pay for the remote - note - it doesn't mean tthat the tv works (it probably doesnt - it didn't in 2 of the 3 rooms we rented). Fourth - what is that discusting smell? Is it sewage? There were so many moments of "oh my god this is discusting" that I can't list them. I can only warn people never to stay there. A youth hostel is a better bet. I will leave you with this... my room wasn't nearly as bad as my colleague who was stuck int he basement. They gave him a "single" which used to be a closet. They couldn't fit a full twin. The only saving grace was that he was next to the boiler room which took his mind off the fact that he was in a box. Last... they had the gall to charge additional if you paid with a credit card. what a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Caroline31
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Quentin Hotel from 24 to 27 October. STeps to hotel are steep and there is very little leg room on them. Rooms are tiny. The room we stayed in was over luggage room, which was in fact a boiler room so the heat was unbearable. It was like a sweat box. Could not open the window at nite time because it was too noisy. On website it said there was a bar but when i asked they told me no. Towels were not changed in the room while we stayed there. Staff were friendly and helpful. I feel the hotel was poor value for money and the money was taken from my account as soon as I checked in. Would not recommend to stay there

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: TJEmerson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this Hotel on a holiday trip with Hostelworld.com. We had to cancel the Amsterdam leg of the trip.I notified the Hotel direct 3 months before we were due to arrive as instructed by the wholesaler, I was aware that I would lose 10% that I paid to Hostelworld. I was charged the full nights accommodation by the Hotel on my visa card. I have sent numerous emails telling them that I had cancelled the booking and supplied a copy of the email.The replys were nothing short of a joke, I had the feeling that it was incompetence at a high level or else it is the Hotels policy to delete any cancellations and then charge as a "No Show". I would suggest that if you must stay at this Hotel do not let them have your credit card details.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Quentin during a business conference and to be honest it spoilt the event. Not only did it ooze inefficency it was just plain horrible. For example: No towels in the rooms and when requested for one (yes just the one) it took near on 15 mins to receive it. Room was a suppose to be a double, all I'll say is it was a good job I was staying on my own !! Carpet was grubby, the wardrobe was on it's last legs - and I mean that literaly, as bits were hanging off it! The phone didnt work. The shower took 10 mins for warm water to filter through and then we it finally did it was unregulated - shift from warm to scolding hot in a flash. Radiator didnt work full stop ! Basically I was very disappointed and would not stay at the place again. In addition to the above they made you pay on arrival and swiped your credit card for good measure - just in case you damaged your room !! And their computer system seemed to ran at less than a snails pace. Apologies if you think this is really damning but it is an honest and frank opinion. I only wish I'd booked up earlier at one of the other nearby hotels!!

Reviews.Title: “Not so good . . .”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a work colleague from 5th April 2006 for two nights. We were less than impressed. On arrival, we were made to pay in full for our two night stay and we were then asked for an imprint of our credit cards because "we've had things broken in the rooms before". Nice to be branded a vandal the moment you walk in! There was then confusion over the rooms we'd booked even though we had our confirmation slips with us. My colleague ended up in what can only be described (at best) as a broom cupboard. It was tiny plus the wardrobe and other fittings were literally falling apart. No towels in either of our rooms meant we both had to go back to reception to ask for some, only to be met by a large queue of people (also seemingly not happy with proceedings) waiting to check-in. Breakfast in the hotel is extra and, again, they make you pay for it on arrival. Our advice to you is don't. Go out and find something in the nearby square - it'll be better food and better value. Our overall impression of the Quentin hotel is that it's being run on a (very thin) shoestring and for 100 Euro's a night, I expected better. There are other hotels in Amsterdam for similar money on this site, some of which get great reviews, so my advice is to stay in one of them.

HotelInfo.Name: Quentin Amsterdam Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Leidsekade 89, Amsterdam 1017 PN, The Netherlands
